title: Ellen Johnson Sirleaf | Academy of Achievement

quotes: Archbishop Emeritus Desmond Tutu of South Africa presents the Golden Plate Award to the President of Liberia, Ellen Johnson Sirleaf, at the 2008 International Achievement Summit in Hawaii.

2017: Madame President: The Extraordinary Journey of Ellen Johnson Sirleaf by Helene Cooper is the inspiring, often heartbreaking story of Johnson Sirleaf’s evolution from an ordinary Liberian mother of four boys to international banking executive, from a victim of domestic violence to a political icon, from a post-war president to a Nobel Peace Prize winner.
In 2010, Newsweek magazine listed Johnson Sirleaf as one of the “Ten Best Leaders in the World,”
In 2011, she was awarded the Nobel Prize for Peace, along with women’s rights campaigners Leymah Gbowee of Liberia and Tawakkul Karman of

organizations.name: United States Congress
quotes: A strong ally of the United States, President Johnson Sirleaf addressed a joint session of the United States Congress shortly after her inauguration.

organizations.name: Mano River Union
quotes: She chairs the Mano River Union, fostering peace and economic cooperation among the neighboring nations of Liberia, Sierra Leone, Guinea, and Côte d’Ivoire.
